An oval with a number on the right of a tree item. For example, the number of updates in Plugins or problems in the Project Structure view.

Background of the selected tab in the Debugger tool window. The foreground is EditorTabs.underlinedTabForeground.
Background for the selected tab
Default tabs are applied to all tabs except TabbedPane and unless particular tab keys, e.g. EditorTabs, are set. This key is the background under all tabs.
Default tabs are applied to all tabs except TabbedPane and unless particular tab keys, e.g. EditorTabs, are set. This key is the border color for all tabs.
Transparent background on hover over tabs, both regular and with file color.

The editor tabs border color. If value isn't specified the value of DefaultTabs.borderColor will be used
Transparent overlay on editor tab hover. If value isn't specified the value of DefaultTabs.hoverBackground will be used
Masks inactive tabs with file color. Does not affect tabs without file color.
Selected tab underline color when the tab is not in focus. If value isn't specified the value of DefaultTabs.inactiveUnderlineColor will be used
Background for all tabs in 2019.1
Foreground of the selected tab when a file status color is not used. Inactive tabs use Label.foreground.

Light-colored links. Used in the Variables tab of the Debugger tool window. Can be seen when a tree line is long, does not fit into the tab's width, and its popup on hover goes beyond the right monitor side.
